ery small, etc., etc. Naturally he concludes that
these are necessary properties of machines in general. Many of these limita-
tions are associated with the very small storage capacity of most machines. (I
am assuming that the idea of storage capacity is extended in some way to cover
machines other than discrete state machines. The exact definition does not mat-
ter as no mathematical accuracy is claimed in the present discussion.) A few
years ago, when very little had been heard of digital comp
